intro.p: Below is an analysis of the growth in cell phones per 100 people by country, as compiled by the Gapminder organization from publicly available data for 195 countries.

image.description: Scatter plot and regression line showing number of cell phone per 100 in 2000 vs 2019

intro.p: Below is the regression model information for the scatterplot above of the number of cell phones per 100 people from countries around the world in 2000 vs in 2019.

item.p: Equation and R^2 value for the number of cells phone per 100 in 2019 versus 2000.
(Cell Phones per 100 people in 2019) = 94.3 + 0.67 * (Cell Phones per 100 people in 2000)
The R^2 value for this regression is 0.1640
